metadata.title: Earth's Magnificent Oceans - The Blue Heart of Our Living Planet

narration.voiceOver: Bienvenue. Pense à l’océan non pas comme des morceaux avec des noms, mais comme un seul corps en mouvement—des courants qui relient chaque côte. Je te guiderai et donnerai un indice si besoin.

show.text: Earth's Magnificent Oceans - The Blue Heart of Our Living Planet

narration.voiceOver: Question un. Quelle description convient le mieux—des océans séparés qui ne s’influencent pas, ou un océan mondial relié par des courants? Choisis quand tu es prêt(e).
narration.onNoChoice: Indice: l’énergie et la vie circulent par des courants autour du monde—un océan connecté.

extra.a: Separate oceans that don't affect each other
extra.b: One global ocean connected by currents

show.text: Exactly. We name parts, but currents link them into one body—energy and life flow around the world.
They have names, yes—but water, heat, salt, and life constantly mix. The ocean acts as one connected system.

choices.text: Separate oceans that don't affect each other
One global ocean connected by currents

teachingMoments.a: They have names, yes—but water, heat, salt, and life constantly mix. The ocean acts as one connected system.
teachingMoments.b: Exactly. We name parts, but currents link them into one body—energy and life flow around the world.

narration.voiceOver: Question deux. Qu’est‑ce qui entraîne surtout les grandes ‘chaînes’ de l’océan—seulement les marées de la Lune, ou le vent avec les différences de température et de sel (densité)? Choisis quand tu es prêt(e).
narration.onNoChoice: Le vent pousse la surface; la chaleur et le sel changent la densité—ensemble ils déplacent l’eau.

extra.a: Only the tides from the Moon

show.text: Right. Wind pushes the surface, the Sun makes temperature differences, and salt changes density—together they steer great conveyors.
Tides matter near coasts, but big global flows need more than a gentle tug—temperature and salt make water sink and rise.

choices.text: Only the tides from the Moon

narration.voiceOver: Question trois. Pourquoi des océans en bonne santé comptent‑ils pour toi et moi—seulement pour les poissons et les plages, ou pour l’oxygène, l’équilibre du climat, la nourriture et les moyens de subsistance? Choisis quand tu es prêt(e).
narration.onNoChoice: Inspire—la moitié de ton oxygène vient de l’océan. Il nous nourrit et nous stabilise—choisissons cette option.

show.text: Why are healthy oceans essential for people?

extra.a: It's mainly about fish and beaches
extra.b: Oxygen, climate balance, food, and livelihoods

show.text: Exactly. The ocean breathes with us, feeds us, carries ships and stories—our daily life depends on it.
Yes, and so much more—the ocean makes oxygen, feeds families, and keeps our climate steady.

narration.voiceOver: Wisdom to carry: care for the ocean and it cares for you—each breath, each meal, each calm day. Do one small protective act today.

show.text: Care for the ocean, and it will keep caring for you—every breath, every meal, every calm day.
